oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Shujāʻ-i Ḥaydarī va-ʻajāʼib al-buldān : manuscript, undated
Ajāʼib al-buldān
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Muḥammad Ḥaydar , active 17th century
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Widener Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University Houghton Library, Harvard University
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Fabulous accounts of the marvels of various real and imaginary countries.
Written in one column, from 8 to 17 lines per page, in black and red ink, framed within triple red, black and yellow lines.
Illuminated title page and about 350 colored paintings in the text.
Cream laid paper. 24.6 x 13.8 cm. (17.8 x 8 cm.).
Includes tipped-in 1904 Dec. 5 autograph letter from MHM (Harvard Professor Morris Hicky Morgan) to Daniel B. Fearing concerning future translation of this text by Professor Leo Wiener.
MS Persian 63. Houghton Library, Harvard University.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wiener, Leo--1862-1939
Kashmir--Description and travel
Iran--Description and travel
Asia, Central--Description and travel
